questions.answer_description:
Part of the "show ip ospf topology" command on R5 shows this:

The Link ID of R3 (3.3.3.3) shows the age is 1858.

discussion.content:
Do not use ""show ip ospf topology"" but ""show ip ospf database".

Syntax ""show ip ospf topology"" relates to EIGRP but not to OSPF.

questions.answer_ET: E. Change the metric to an EIGRP compatible metric value (bandwidth, delay, reliability, load, MTUs) in the redistribute command.

choices.C: Change the EIGRP AS number from 100 to 1 in the redistribute command.
choices.B: Configure the redistribute command under router eigrp 1 instead.
choices.D: Add the subnets option to the redistribute command.
choices.A: Change the metric-type to 2 in the redistribute command.

questions.answer: E. Change the metric to an EIGRP compatible metric value (bandwidth, delay, reliability, load, MTUs) in the redistribute command.
questions.answer_description:
In this example, the router is configured for EIGRP AS 1, but EIGRP AS 100 is being redistributed into OSPF so the EIGRP AS needs to be changed from 100 to
1. The subnets keyword tells OSPF to redistribute all subnet routes. Without the subnets keyword, only networks that are not subnetted are redistributed by OSPF.
Example:

RTA(config)#router ospf 109 -
RTA(config-router)#redistribute rip subnets
RTA(config-router)#network 130.10.62.0 0.0.0.255 area 0 RTA(config-router)#network 130.10.63.0 0.0.0.255 area 0 The subnets keyword tells OSPF to redistribute all subnet routes. Without the subnets keyword, only networks that are not subnetted are redistributed by OSPF.

discussion.content:
C. Change the EIGRP AS number from 100 to 1 in the redistribute command.
D. Add the subnets option to the redistribute command.
D. None, EIGRP and IGRP are automatically redistributed in this instance.

choices.B: Under the router eigrp mode add redistribute igrp 123
choices.C: Under the router eigrp mode add redistribute igrp 123 subnets
choices.A: Under the router igrp mode add redistribute eigrp 123

questions.question_text:
Given the accompanying output, which additional command is needed to redistribute IGRP into EIGRP?

Router eigrp 123 -

Network 10.10.10.0 -

No auto-summary -
!

Router igrp 123 -

Network 172.16.0.0 -

Network 172.17.0.0 -
questions.answer: D. None, EIGRP and IGRP are automatically redistributed in this instance.
questions.answer_ET: D. None, EIGRP and IGRP are automatically redistributed in this instance.
questions.answer_description: The point of this question is redistribute IGRP into EIGRP. When redistributing IGRP into EIGRP, there is a feature that they are automatically redistributed if they have same autonomous system number; in opposite, they need to manually redistributed if they have different autonomous system number..

choices.B: The summary route remains in the route table, even if there are no more specific routes to the network.
choices.C: Summarization is configured on a per-interface level.
choices.A: When summarization is configured, the router will also create a route to null 0.
choices.D: The maximum metric for the specific routes is used as the metric for the summary route.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about EIGRP operation? (Choose three.)
questions.answer: E. Automatic summarization across major network boundaries is enabled by default.
questions.answer_ET: E. Automatic summarization across major network boundaries is enabled by default.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about the EIGRP DUAL process are correct? (Choose two.)
questions.answer: F. EIGRP queries are sent during the loading state in the EIGRP neighbor establishment process.
questions.answer_ET: F. EIGRP queries are sent during the loading state in the EIGRP neighbor establishment process.

choices.D: A feasible successor in the EIGRP topology table can become the successor only after all the query requests have been replied to.
choices.C: DUAL will trigger an EIGRP query process while placing the flapping routes in the holddown state.
choices.E: The stuck in active state is caused when the wait for the query replies have timed out.
choices.A: An EIGRP route will go active if there are no successors or feasible successors in the EIGRP topology table.
choices.B: An EIGRP route will go passive if there are no successors in the EIGRP topology table.
